author: Susan Gilbert
title: Reach More Influencers with 4 Great Tools
text:
Reach More Influencers with 4 Great Tools 0 SHARES August 3, 2015 Strategy 0 Increase Your Influencer Connections with These 4 Tools 
Monday Tips is a short list of the best finds across the internet to start your week off right. 
Today I have some resources to help you connect with more influencers in your industry. Here’s four links with tips and tricks to kick start your Monday. 
Networking online is not difficult with the right focus and proper research. Your brand or business can build a reputation by forging relationships with the right individuals or companies in your niche. There are several helpful tools that help you find what’s trending and who is sharing. Would you like to improve your branding strategy? Take advantage of these resources for influencers, and let me know how these work for you! 1) Website analytics for mobile and computers – Mixpanel 
Discovering who is checking out your landing page can take time and research. Mixpanel , is a great tool that allows you to gather powerful analytics on individual visitors to find out what action they are taking. The software goes way beyond just page views, and focuses on visitor actions. Learn information on referrals from mobile, who your Google Adwords campaigns are attracting, the location of your readers, and much more. A free trial is available and the signup takes about 10 minutes. Recommended for You Webcast: Build a Powerful Network and Accelerate your Growth 2) Build the right relationships online – Sidekick 
If you would like to find high-level influencers in your industry, but don’t know where to start then this tool will help you gain access quickly. Hubspot has created a great resource called, Sidekick , which allows you to see who is opening your emails so that you can respond. This allows you to build open communication with a targeted email list with access to profiles and tracking. The tool will also soon feature an email scheduler with reminders to help you stay on track for your day. 3) Find the best content for your niche – Topsy 
After doing your research into what your competitors are posting your business will need to find articles that your influencers are sharing on their blogs and on social media. With Topsy you can search for topics, find tweets for your keywords, discover top content providers in your industry, and even find popular images and videos. These are valuable resources to glean from, share, and comment on to build relationships online. 4) Use Gmail to run your business – Streak 
Would you like to track bloggers and subscribers right inside your Gmail account? Streak is a simple to use tool that integrates with your email system in order to help you keep track and organize your new connections. Easily collaborate with influencers, manage new deals, and combine existing Google apps all in one place. Since everything is based in the cloud you have access to your data wherever you go, which cannot be lost. 
Hopefully you will find these tools for influencers useful to your branding strategy. Are there any that you would like to add as well? 
Have fun with these Monday Tips and Tools.
